intro: Eulophidium lokobense, commonly known as the African grasshopper plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and savannas. Due to its adaptability, it is considered an important component of local ecosystems and has potential uses in traditional medicine.
